content.question: For <math alttext="t greater than or equal to 0" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>≥</mo><mn>0</mn></mrow></mstyle></math>, a particle moves in the <math alttext="x y" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mi>y</mi></mrow></mstyle></math>-plane with position vector <math alttext="open angled bracket, x of t, comma, y of t, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>, where <math alttext="x of t, equals, t times e to the negative t power" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>x</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>t</mi><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mi>t</mi></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow></mstyle></math> and <math alttext="y of t, equals, the natural log of, open parenthesis, 2 t, plus 6, close parenthesis" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>y</mi><mrow><mo>(</mo><mi>t</mi><mo>)</mo></mrow><mo>=</mo><mi>ln</mi><mo>⁡</mo><mrow><mo>(</mo><mn>2</mn><mi>t</mi><mo>+</mo><mn>6</mn><mo>)</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>. What is the acceleration vector of the particle at time <math alttext="t equals 2" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mi>t</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mstyle></math> ?

choices.label: <math alttext="open angled bracket, 0 comma, negative, 1 over 100, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, 0 comma, negative, 1 over 25, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, e to the negative 2 power, comma, negative, 1 over 25, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

<math alttext="open angled bracket, 4 times e to the negative 2 power, comma, negative, 1 over 100, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>4</mn><msup><mrow><mi>e</mi></mrow><mrow><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mn>2</mn></mrow></mrow></mrow></msup></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>100</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="open angled bracket, 0 comma, negative, 1 over 25, close angled bracket" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mstyle><mrow><mrow><mo>⟨</mo><mrow><mrow><mn>0</mn></mrow><mo>,</mo><mrow><mrow><mo>−</mo><mfrac><mrow><mn>1</mn></mrow><mrow><mn>25</mn></mrow></mfrac></mrow></mrow></mrow><mo>⟩</mo></mrow></mrow></mstyle></math>

unit.text: 9: Parametric Equations, Polar Coordinates, and Vector-Valued Functions

topic.text: 9.6: (BC ONLY) Solving Motion Problems Using Parametric and Vector-Valued Functions

skill.text: Skill 1.E: Apply appropriate mathematical rules or procedures, with and without technology.
